snippet: Two marines were shot to death on Sunday at a motel here, and another marine was transferred to police custody after being taken into custody at his base as a suspect.    The suspect, Lance Cpl. Byron O'Neal, 24, left a motel in Oceanside, the Gra...
lead_paragraph: Two marines were shot to death on Sunday at a motel here, and another marine was transferred to police custody after being taken into custody at his base as a suspect. The suspect, Lance Cpl. Byron O'Neal, 24, left a motel in Oceanside, the Grandee Inn, shortly after the shootings and returned to his base at Twentynine Palms, 70 miles northeast of here, detectives said. The police identified the dead men as Pfc. Dasan T. Jones and Pfc. Kenneth M. Norman 2d.
abstract: Oceanside, Calif, police arrest Byron O'Neal, corporal in US Marine Corps, in fatal shooting of two colleagues at local motel following argument (S)

headline.main: Corporal Held in Killings of Fellow Marines
